job.description:
{"@context": "http://schema.org", "@type": "JobPosting", "datePosted": "2021-08-04T19:11:24.000Z", "description": "

Modis has partnered with a unique company located in the Seattle, WA area to help find an experienced Software Engineer. The Client is a GIS software and services firm, and they create custom applications for both the web as well as distributed and scalable workflow applications. Many of their applications rely on specialty GIS/mapping software, especially from the MapInfo family of products.


As a Software Engineer, you will be responsible for creating custom web and desktop applications in a collaborative team environment, writing mostly in C# and Javascript/Typescript and using numerous third party packages including cartographic and database tools. About 80% of your time will be spent creating features - planning, research, writing code (including unit tests), and reviewing. You will also support the Operations team in their work on acceptance testing, deployment, and technical support. The other 20% of your time will be spent on agile process meetings including daily standups, ad hoc planning meetings, biweekly retrospectives, lunch and learn events, and staff meetings.



Skills You Will Use:


TECHNICAL


\uf0b7 4+ years of professional software engineering/development experience

\uf0b7 Write front and back-end code with unit tests.

\uf0b7 Model solutions to geometric, cartographic, and statistical problems.

\uf0b7 Solve bugs efficiently.

\uf0b7 Take unfamiliar code and figure out what it is doing.

\uf0b7 Create complex SQL queries and analyze indexing for performance.

\uf0b7 Ability to quickly learn new software and technical skills

\uf0b7 Ability to research and troubleshoot technical issues

\uf0b7 Ability to follow and understand a complex distributed algorithm


SOCIAL/COOPERATIVE


\uf0b7 Strong written and oral communication skills

\uf0b7 Collaborative approach with team members

\uf0b7 Ability to prioritize and shift smoothly between tasks

\uf0b7 Resolve interpersonal conflicts professionally

\uf0b7 Ability to accept and offer constructive feedback

\uf0b7 Willingness to ask for and offer help as needed

\uf0b7 Willingness to take ownership of responsibilities and decisions

\uf0b7 Active engagement with commitment to helping create an inclusive workplace.


Benefits:


\uf0b7 a comprehensive health insurance plan

\uf0b7 company matching 401K retirement plan

\uf0b7 standard business holidays (including your birthday)

\uf0b7 sick and safe time exceeding the requirements of Seattle law

\uf0b7 vacation time starting at 10 days per year and increasing to a maximum of 17 days per year

\uf0b7 a yearly profit-sharing bonus

\uf0b7 optional 40 hours paid volunteer time

\uf0b7 annual COLA salary adjustments

\uf0b7 Monthly \u201copposite\u201d days to pursue innovation ideas and present to the team.
